column4: do you know how do I fix this problem? dpkg-deb: control directory has bad permissions 777 (must be >=0755 and <=0775)
try chown 0755 /var/lib/dpkg
sudo that
Why it'd be different, idk though... did you change it?
i'm trying for my first time to build a package.. and that gives me that problem when I dpkg-deb --build it!!
i've already tried this too: find ./debian -type d | xargs chmod 755
look around https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuDevelopment you shouldn't generally be using dpkg-deb yourself.
y not? is that "dangerous"? :) just asking!
Although that doesn't really help your current problem...
It just results in more work, and there are easier alternatives...
You need the source directory to have a /debian dir too, and there are tools to easily populate all the things needed.
Trying to create a .deb from a normal source tar.gz etc will not work.
